specialConditions: Coverage contingent on approved and certified stunt coordinators for all stunt sequences.
Licensed and insured animal handlers required for all scenes involving animals.
Specific safety protocols for centrifuge, zero-g rigs, and underwater work must be approved and followed.
International operations require local security consultation and a comprehensive medical evacuation plan.
Coverage for custom rigs (centrifuge, motion control) requires pre-production engineering review, testing, and certification.
Underwater housing must be pressure-tested and certified before each use.
A comprehensive equipment carnet is required for all gear transported to international locations.
Full medical examinations required for all insured essential elements prior to binding coverage.
Stunt work performed by principal actors must be reviewed and approved by the stunt coordinator and insurer.
Coverage for child actors requires adherence to all local and international child labor laws and dedicated on-set supervision.
Clearance reports for script, music, stock footage, and chain of title are required prior to binding coverage.

deliveryRequirements: Final cut delivered on or before approved delivery date.
Strict adherence to approved budget and shooting schedule.
All clearance documentation and legal deliverables finalized and submitted.
specialConditions: Weekly detailed progress and cost reports required by bond company representative.
Bond company reserves the right to approve all key creative/production hires and any significant script, schedule, or budget changes.
Bond company has the right to take over production if critical deviations from the approved plan occur.

unprecedentedTechnologyFailure.description: Covers delays from the failure of pioneering technologies (centrifuge, motion control, front projection).

civilAuthority.description: Covers delays due to unforeseen government action or civil unrest in international locations.

riskFactors.description: Pioneering use of unproven technology (centrifuge, motion control, front projection) with no historical data for failure rates.
Production in remote international locations (Kenya, Tanzania) with moderate political risk, complex logistics, and wildlife exposure.
Complex stunt work, including simulated zero-gravity and underwater sequences, involving principal cast.
Highly ambitious and abstract narrative combined with a director known for meticulous, schedule-extending perfectionism, increasing completion risk.

recommendations: Implement a mandatory 'testing and sign-off' phase for all new technology before it is used in principal photography.
Establish a dedicated on-site medical team and medevac plan for all international and high-risk location work.
Engage a specialist risk management consultant to oversee stunt and special effects safety protocols.
Maintain a close and transparent relationship with the completion bond company, providing weekly detailed progress reports.
